text.name: info1
text.text: An arcade game or coin-op game is a coin-operated entertainment

text.name: info2
text.text: machine. Most arcade games are video games, pinball machines,

text.name: info3
text.text: electro-mechanical games, redemption games or merchandisers.

text.name: info4
text.text: While exact dates are debated, the golden age of arcade video games

text.name: info5
text.text: is usually defined as a period beginning sometime in the late 1970s and

text.name: info6
text.text: ending sometime in the mid-1980s. Excluding a brief resurgence in the

text.name: info7
text.text: early 1990s, the arcade industry subsequently declined in the

text.name: info8
text.text: Western hemisphere as competing home video game consoles increased

text.name: info9
text.text: in their graphics and game-play capability and decreased in cost.
